description: The department has a  requirement for a contractor to print four quarterly editions of the Canadian Military Journal and an option for an additional special edition.
full_summary:
**Commonwealth Military Journal Printing Services Contract**

Government Contract ID: WS4095742935
Publication Date: July 12, 2023

### Tender Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), on behalf of the Department of National Defence (DND), is inviting offers to provide printing services for the Commonwealth Military Journal (CMJ) in both English and French.

### Tender Description

The Crown requires a contractor to print four quarterly editions of the CMJ per annum, with an optional additional edition each year. The contract has a one-year term with the possibility of two further one-year extensions. All work will be performed in accordance with PSPC's standard requirements and guidelines.

### Important Dates

* Publication Date: July 12, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: July 24, 2023, at 14:00:00 (EDT)
* Expected Contract Start Date: August 1, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: None (One-year term with option to extend)

### Tendering Opportunities

This is an open tendering process, and interested suppliers can submit their proposals electronically through Ariba Discovery.

### Contact Information

For further information, please contact:
Nadeem Mughal (SPAC/PSPC)
nadeem.mughal@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Notice URL

You can access the detailed notice and supporting documentation at the following URL:
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16851189?extsite=MTY4NTExODlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### Trade Agreements

This tender opportunity is subject to the following trade agreements:
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement

### Regions of Delivery

The printing services are required for the Department of National Defence (DND) and are to be delivered in the Kingston region.
